content: I've changed the tag "cinematics" to "Image processing".
I've just reformatted all variables previously formatted as constants.
I've just added "write answer" to the stub generator.

I did this puzzle, but it was confusing because for my firsts attempts all test were ok but it failed for validator 10.
It was for asteroid V, which had an x at -0.5 at time t3,  because I was using int instead of math.floor and that was the only error. so if you can set a similar case in tests it will be a good thing.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool!

Nice easy puzzle.
Note that the C code the stub generator generates is case sensitive. You need to fix it. Once that is done, I will be happy to approve the puzzle.

My Python solution:
import sys
import math
from collections import defaultdict, deque
w, h, t1, t2, t3 = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
asteroids = defaultdict(deque)
for i in range(h):
    first_picture_row, second_picture_row = input().split()
    for j in range(w):
        c,d = first_picture_row[j], second_picture_row[j]
        if c != '.':
            asteroids[c].appendleft((i,j))
        if d != '.':
            asteroids[d].append((i,j))

output = [['.']*w for i in range(h)]
for c in sorted(list(asteroids),reverse=True):
    dt = (t3-t1)/(t2-t1)
    i = math.floor(asteroids[c][0][0] + (asteroids[c][1][0]-asteroids[c][0][0])*dt)
    j = math.floor(asteroids[c][0][1] + (asteroids[c][1][1]-asteroids[c][0][1])*dt)
    if 0<=i and i<h and 0<=j and j<w:
        output[i][j] = c
for row in output:
    print(*row,sep='')
I wish I could read so clear descriptions in puzzles like this.
Nice puzzle, nice difficulty rating.  I don't remember any other easy puzzles like this, so it seems original.  I'll take a look to approve when it is out of WIP.
I will approve it once it is published.

Thanks!
I'll leave it as a WIP for a few more days in case someone has a suggestion :)
Thanks for the feedback!
Thank you!
Thanks!

Thanks for the feedback!
Nice catch! I have updated the contribution.

Ah yes indeed I did not foresee the usage of int() instead of floor.
The contribution has been updated so that Test Case 10 has the same "V" asteroid as Validator 10.
Sorry for the inconvenience this may have caused!
Is it already in CoC or moved to classic puzzle?
I have deleted the CoC contribution and created a new classic puzzle one instead.
